page.title: 14The Village Hall Ditchling
page.content: Ditchling possesses a fine village hall built on the site of a boys' preparatory school which was burnt down in l9l9.In l973 further additions and improvements were made and there is quite a large car park surrounding the hall. It is in constant use by village organisations such as the Women's Institute,Royal British Legion,Sussex History Study Group,Village Association,Evergreens,Film Society, Baby Clinic,Preservation Society,Foot_ path Society and Handworkers Guild. The Horticultural Society hold 3 annual shows and the Players put on two plays a year.The hall is also used for weddings and other private social functions.There is a small library permanently on site.
